document_title: Acute gastritis: Causes, symptoms, diagnosis and treatment
subsection_content:
Acute gastritis is a condition in which the stomach lining suddenly becomes inflamed or irritated, causing severe and persistent pain. Specifically, in this case, the organ activated an immune response, attracting white blood cells to the site of damage, causing inflammation. The higher the severity, the more likely acute gastritis will progress to an erosive state, creating ulcers and small areas of bleeding within the mucosa.
The disease can appear at any age, but is most common in middle-aged and elderly people. Inflammation comes from many different causes, possibly due to injury, bacteria, virus invasion, stress or diet...(1)
